You want to start a new container from the `nginx` image and detach it (run in background).

Write the command to do this.

title: Building an Image ğŸ—ï¸
ques:
You have a `Dockerfile` in the current directory. You want to build an image named `my-app` from it.

Write the build command.
explanation: **`docker build -t <name> .`** builds an image from the Dockerfile in the current directory (`.`) and tags it with a name.

title: Dockerfile Basics ğŸ“„
ques: Which instruction must be the first non-comment line in a Dockerfile to specify the base image?
explanation: **`FROM`** specifies the parent image from which you are building your new image.

title: Executing Commands ğŸ’»
ques:
You have a running container with ID `abc1234`. You want to open an interactive bash shell inside it.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker exec -it <id> bash`** opens an interactive terminal session inside the running container.

title: Listing Containers ğŸ“‹
ques:
You want to see a list of **all** containers, including those that are stopped.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker ps -a`** lists all containers, filtering out none (shows stopped, exited, and running containers).
